node.title: 'We are coming after you': Washington sues the Proud Boys and Oath Keepers over US Capitol attack
node.alt: A member of the Proud Boys attends a "Let's Go Brandon Festival" rally.
node.description: The lawsuit invokes the Ku Klux Klan Act of 1871, which allows people to sue for civil rights violations — a move some hope will expose the financial support structure of the far-right extremist network.
node.content:
["Far-right extremist groups the Proud Boys and the Oath Keepers are being sued by Washington, DC.", "The city is seeking harsh financial penalties against the groups over their role in the January 6 attack\u00a0at the US Capitol.", "The lawsuit invokes the Ku Klux Klan Act of 1871, which allows people to sue for civil rights violations \u2014 a move some hope will expose the financial support structure of the far-right extremist network.", "Here's what we know so far.", "
Who are the Proud Boys and Oath Keepers?
", "The Proud Boys have been named by United States security agencies as playing a\u00a0pivotal role\u00a0in the January attack on the US Capitol, and at\u00a0least\u00a034 individuals\u00a0associated with the group have been indicted over it.", "A federal grand jury has also indicted\u00a018 members\u00a0of the Oath Keepers for allegedly planning a\u00a0coordinated attack to storm the Capitol, including by travelling to Washington with paramilitary gear and supplies.", "", "
The city is seeking harsh financial penalties against the groups.(AP:\u00a0Noah Berger (File))
", "Last month, both groups were\u00a0subpoenaed by a Select Committee investigating the deadly riot, which ordered them to turn over documents and appear for testimony this month.", "", "
A federal grand jury has also indicted 18 members of the Oath Keepers for allegedly planning a coordinated attack to storm the Capitol.(Reuters:\u00a0Jim Bourg)
", "
What is the lawsuit asking for?
", "Prosecutors say the two groups played a leading role in the attack by thousands of supporters of then-president Donald Trump\u00a0and the suit aims to hold them financially accountable for that.", "District of Columbia Attorney-General Karl Racine said the defendants had caused physical and financial harm to Washington and its residents, adding that the city would seek \"severe\" financial penalties.", "", "
Prosecutors say the two groups played a leading role in the attack by thousands of supporters of then-president Donald Trump.(Reuters: Leah Millis)
", "The lawsuit seeks to recover the costs of deploying roughly 1,100 city police officers to bolster other police forces who defended the Capitol against the attack, which it says amounts to millions of dollars.", "It also seeks to recover medical and paid-leave costs incurred afterward for the more than 65 officers injured during the assault and the more than 1,000 who have sought therapy since.", "", "
The lawsuit seeks to recover medical and paid-leave costs incurred afterward for the more than 65 officers injured during the assault.(AP: Julio Cortez)
", "
Can they really sue two groups over\u00a0the Capitol attack?
", "They can.", "The city is invoking a 150-year-old law passed after the Civil War to shield freed slaves from violence and protect their civil rights.", "Commonly known as the Ku Klux Klan Act, the law contains a rarely used provision that allows private citizens to sue other citizens for civil rights violations.", "In more recent years, it's been used to file suits against a convoy of Donald Trump supporters who\u00a0swarmed a Joe Biden campaign bus\u00a0and even the former president himself.", "In a civil lawsuit filed earlier this year by Bennie Thompson, the head of the committee investigating the assault on the Capitol, Mr Trump and his lawyer Rudy Giuliani were accused of conspiring with the Proud Boys and Oath Keepers to incite the January 6 attack.", "A similar tactic was used to secure a $US26 million ($35 million) verdict last month against white supremacist groups and individuals responsible for organising the violent 2017 Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, Virginia.", "", "
A similar tactic was used to secure a verdict last month against white supremacist groups\u00a0responsible for organising the violent Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, Virginia.(Reuters: Stephanie Keith )
", "
Are they likely to get any money?
", "It's hard to say for sure \u2014 but the city has been clear that compensation isn't necessarily\u00a0the end goal.", "According to Eleanor Holmes Norton, a lawyer and congresswoman in Washington, who helped launch the suit against the Proud Boys and Oath Keepers, \"they're going to have to spend money to defend themselves\".", "", "
The lawsuit seeks to recover the costs of deploying roughly 1,100 city police officers to bolster other police forces who defended the Capitol against the attack.(AP: Jose Luis Magana)
", "Mr Racine added that\u00a0the lawsuit presents an opportunity to publicly explore and expose the financial support structure of the far-right extremist network.", "\"I sure hope they try to defend the case,\u201d he said.", "\u201cWe can\u2019t wait to propound searing questions about the finances of these individuals and these groups.\"", "ABC/wires"]
